frame.name: Memorization
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> applies oneself to commit a <fen>Pattern</fen> to memory, so that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> would recognize future examples of the <fen>Pattern</fen> or be able to reproduce it.
<ex><fex name="cog">A gaggle of students</fex> were <fex name="man">frantically</fex> <t>memorizing</t> <fex name="pat">the answers</fex> <fex name="pla">out in the hall</fex>.</ex> <ex>It is possible to <t>memorize</t> <fex name="mea">by rote</fex> and at the same time have a full grasp of the underlying meaning. <fex name="cog">CNI</fex> <fex name="pat">INI</fex></ex>
This frame differs from Education_teaching in that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is construed as acting alone, with no indication of an interacting individual that provides guidance.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sentient being that focuses on a <fen>Pattern</fen> so that it will remain in the memory.
<ex> <fex name="cog">I</fex> have <t>memorized</t> two kinds of knowledge from Allah's Apostle </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Pattern
FE.definition:
<def-root>The phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> observes and commits to memory.
<ex>Impress your friends by <t>memorizing</t> <fex name="pat">your phone numbers</fex> and throwing away your PDA! </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
<ex>Barney <t>memorized</t> the poem <fex name="tim">yesterday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location wherein the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
<ex>Herbert Kornfeldt <t>memorized</t> his speech <fex name="pla">in the mailroom</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the memorization event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Cognizer</fen> that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex><fex name="man">Hurriedly</fex>, the bus-driver <t>memorized</t> the new route.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Completeness
FE.definition:
<def-root>The exactness of the match between the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s memory and the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
<ex>Whomever you emulate, internalize the sound of the soloist and <t>memorize</t> it <fex name="com">exactly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> by which they achieve memorization.
<ex>Don't <t>memorize</t> Morse code <fex name="mea">by counting dots and dashes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The goal that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has in mind, which they believe will be accomplished by memorization.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: memorization.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of committing to memory
